cab.content: COPY.SECRET. WAR CABISBT.G.T.- 308War Office,Whitehall, S.W.28th March, 1917.Secretary,War Cabinet.Herewith ten copies of a telegram, No? 918 dated 26th instant, from General Hanbury-Williams, regarding the question of Poland, which the Chief of the Imperial General Staff desires distributed to the War Cabinet please.(Signed) P. Maurice,D. I, 0.OPERATIONS.Prom:- General Hanbury Williams. 26/3/17*To:- C. I. G. S.918On the subject of Poland Count Zamoiski has spoken to me privately.He hopes new government will take immediate consideration of question, as he fears in present state of affairs that Germans will take advantage of recruiting Poland to their colours unless announcement of governments intentions is made quickly.Italian and French representatives are representing matters to their chiefs.Addressed : Ambassador.
